verses.kjv: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,
verses.ct: Then Zophar the Naamathite spoke up and said,

verses.kjv: Should not the multitude of words be answered? and should a man full of talk be justified?
verses.ct: "Should this flood of words go unchallenged? Does someone who talks this much get to be declared right?

verses.kjv: Should thy lies make men hold their peace? and when thou mockest, shall no man make thee ashamed?
verses.ct: Should your empty claims silence everyone? When you ridicule others, will no one call you out?

verses.kjv: For thou hast said, My doctrine is pure, and I am clean in thine eyes.
verses.ct: You have said, 'My teaching is flawless, and I am pure in your sight.'

verses.kjv: But oh that God would speak, and open his lips against thee;
verses.ct: If only God would speak up and open his mouth to respond to you!

verses.kjv: And that he would shew thee the secrets of wisdom, that they are double to that which is! Know therefore that God exacteth of thee less than thine iniquity deserveth.
verses.ct: If only he would reveal to you the hidden depths of wisdom — for true wisdom is far greater than you realize. Understand this: God is actually demanding less from you than your sins deserve.

verses.kjv: Canst thou by searching find out God? canst thou find out the Almighty unto perfection?
verses.ct: Can you discover the deep things of God by searching? Can you fully grasp the limits of the Almighty?

verses.kjv: It is as high as heaven; what canst thou do? deeper than hell; what canst thou know?
verses.ct: His wisdom is higher than the heavens — what can you do about that? It is deeper than the grave — what can you possibly understand?

verses.kjv: The measure thereof is longer than the earth, and broader than the sea.
verses.ct: Its extent stretches farther than the earth and is wider than the sea.

verses.kjv: If he cut off, and shut up, or gather together, then who can hinder him?
verses.ct: If he passes by, or imprisons someone, or calls a judgment together, who can stop him?

verses.kjv: For he knoweth vain men: he seeth wickedness also; will he not then consider it?
verses.ct: He recognizes worthless people; when he sees evil, does he not take notice of it?

verses.kjv: For vain man would be wise, though man be born like a wild ass’s colt.
verses.ct: A hollow-headed person will gain understanding when a wild donkey gives birth to a human child.

verses.kjv: If thou prepare thine heart, and stretch out thine hands toward him;
verses.ct: But if you set your heart right and reach out your hands to God —

verses.kjv: If iniquity be in thine hand, put it far away, and let not wickedness dwell in thy tabernacles.
verses.ct: if there is sin in your hands, get rid of it, and don't let wickedness have a place in your home —

verses.kjv: For then shalt thou lift up thy face without spot; yea, thou shalt be stedfast, and shalt not fear:
verses.ct: then you will be able to hold your head high without shame. You will stand firm and have nothing to be afraid of.

verses.kjv: Because thou shalt forget thy misery, and remember it as waters that pass away:
verses.ct: You will forget your suffering, remembering it only like water that has flowed past and is gone.

verses.kjv: And thine age shall be clearer than the noonday: thou shalt shine forth, thou shalt be as the morning.
verses.ct: Your life will become brighter than the midday sun. Even your darkest moments will become like the dawn.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt be secure, because there is hope; yea, thou shalt dig about thee, and thou shalt take thy rest in safety.
verses.ct: You will feel secure because there is hope. You will look around you and rest in safety.

verses.kjv: Also thou shalt lie down, and none shall make thee afraid; yea, many shall make suit unto thee.
verses.ct: You will lie down with no one to frighten you, and many people will come seeking your favor.

verses.kjv: But the eyes of the wicked shall fail, and they shall not escape, and their hope shall be as the giving up of the ghost.
verses.ct: But the wicked will lose their vision and find no way to escape. Their only hope will be their last dying breath."
